title: Jo Jo White
summary: Joseph Henry White (November 16, 1946 â€“ January 16, 2018)[1] was an American professional basketball player. As an amateur, he played basketball at the University of Kansas and represented the U.S. men's basketball team during the 1968 Summer Olympics. As a professional, he is best known for his ten-year stint with the Boston Celtics of the NBA, where he led the team towards two NBA championships and set a franchise record of 488 consecutive games played.[2] White was inducted into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame in 2015.
